CAFTA

The goal of CAFTA is to …

Installation

You can install the development version of CAFTA like so:

# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("signorinoy/CAFTA")

Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to fit and update a model using CAFTA:

library(CAFTA)

formula <- Surv(time, status) ~ x1 + x2 + x31 + x42 + x43 + x44
fit <- cafta(formula, sim[sim$group == 1, ], dist = "weibull")
for (k in 2:6) {
  fit <- update(fit, sim[sim$group == k, ])
}
summary(fit)
#> Call:
#> update.cafta(object = fit, newdata = sim[sim$group == k, ])
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>             Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)    
#> (Intercept)  0.32723    0.09943   3.291 0.000997 ***
#> x1           0.20628    0.03153   6.541  6.1e-11 ***
#> x2          -0.18711    0.03245  -5.766  8.1e-09 ***
#> x31          0.13190    0.07638   1.727 0.084184 .  
#> x42          0.19297    0.12076   1.598 0.110036    
#> x43         -0.20334    0.10079  -2.018 0.043638 *  
#> x44          0.39746    0.11215   3.544 0.000394 ***
#> scale        0.76817    0.02553  30.086  < 2e-16 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
